businesslogic

Class CustomerService

  • java.lang.Object
    • businesslogic.CustomerService

  • public class CustomerService
extends java.lang.Object
    Customer Service handles all the operations regarding the Customer Object, including inserting, deleting, updating and building.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CustomerService() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String delete(java.lang.String customerId)
      Deletes an existing customer object from database based on its customer ID.
      Customer getByCustomerId(java.lang.String customerId)
      Retrieves customer Object (if found) by its unique ID from the Broker.
      java.lang.String insert(java.lang.String customerId, java.lang.String houseNumber, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String province, java.lang.String country, java.lang.String postalCode, java.lang.String[] phoneNumberList, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String position, java.lang.String notes)
      Insert calls the CustomerBroker class in order to insert a Customer Object into the database.
      java.util.List<Customer> searchCustomer(java.lang.String keyword)
      Searches through all existing customers for matching keyword using customerBroker.
      java.lang.String update(Customer customerNew)
      Updates exisiting Customer object by matching a newly created temporary Customer object to an existing one.
      java.lang.String update(java.lang.String customerId, java.lang.String houseNumber, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String province, java.lang.String country, java.lang.String postalCode, java.lang.String[] phoneNumberList, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String position, java.lang.String notes)
      Updates existing Customer Object by setting all parameters to updated ones.

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public java.lang.String insert(java.lang.String customerId,
                               java.lang.String houseNumber,
                               java.lang.String street,
                               java.lang.String city,
                               java.lang.String province,
                               java.lang.String country,
                               java.lang.String postalCode,
                               java.lang.String[] phoneNumberList,
                               java.lang.String firstName,
                               java.lang.String lastName,
                               java.lang.String companyName,
                               java.lang.String email,
                               java.lang.String position,
                               java.lang.String notes)
        Insert calls the CustomerBroker class in order to insert a Customer Object into the database.
        Parameters:
        customerId - the unique customer ID as a String
        houseNumber - customer's houseNumber as a String
        street - customer's streetname as a String
        city - customer's city as a String
        province - customer's province as a String
        country - customer's country as a String
        postalCode - customer's postal code as a String
        phoneNumberList - customer's phone number(s) as string(s)
        firstName - customer's first name as a String
        lastName - customer's last name as a String
        companyName - customer's company name as a String
        email - customer's email address as a String
        position - customer's position within their company as a string
        notes - employee notes on customer as a string
        Returns:
        status of insertion in database

      • getByCustomerId

        public Customer getByCustomerId(java.lang.String customerId)
        Retrieves customer Object (if found) by its unique ID from the Broker.
        Parameters:
        customerId - Customer's unique ID
        Returns:
        customer Object

      • searchCustomer

        public java.util.List<Customer> searchCustomer(java.lang.String keyword)
        Searches through all existing customers for matching keyword using customerBroker.
        Parameters:
        keyword - search term entered
        Returns:
        list of customer(s)

        public java.lang.String update(Customer customerNew)

        Returns:
